nudge.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to push someone gently, usually with your elbow, in order to get their attention
nudge.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Jill nudged him in the ribs.
nudge.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to move something or someone a short distance by gently pushing
nudge.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: She nudged the glass towards me.
David nudged me out of the way.
nudge.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to move forward slowly by pushing gently
nudge.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: I started to nudge my way to the front of the crowd.
nudge.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to gently persuade or encourage someone to take a particular decision or action
nudge.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Weâ€™re trying to nudge them towards a practical solution.
nudge.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: to almost reach a particular level or amount
nudge.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: Outside the temperature was nudging 30 degrees Celsius.
nudge.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to increase the value or position of something on a scale by a small amount, or to increase or move up by a small amount
nudge.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Investors bought blue chips again, nudging the Dow Jones Industrial Average to another all-time high.
Honda increased its share of the car market even though its sales nudged up only slightly.
